dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/716448779 at Wed Sep  2 16:48:15 UTC 2020

panels.description:
_Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better._
  
### Component Thresholds  
_Satisfactory/Tolerable_  
 * shard_catchall: 10s  
 * shard_catchnfs: 10s  
 * shard_database_throttled: 300s  
 * shard_elasticsearch: 300s  
 * shard_gitaly_throttled: 300s  
 * shard_low_urgency_cpu_bound: 300s  
 * shard_memory_bound: 300s  
 * shard_urgent_cpu_bound: 10s  
 * shard_urgent_other: 10s

targets.expr:
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Latency: Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="sidekiq"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}),
  1
)

max by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} offset 1w)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:

(avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} or gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"})

)
or
sum by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"} offset 1w
  or

)

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
    ALERTS{environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="sidekiq", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="sidekiq", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="sidekiq", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="sidekiq", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (environment, alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="shard_catchall",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[$__interval])
or on(component, type)
(
  sum by (component, type) (
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio{component="shard_catchall",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[$__interval]) >= 0)
    *
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="shard_catchall",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[10m]) >= 0)
  )
  /
  sum by (component, type) (
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="shard_catchall",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[10m]) >= 0)
  )
)

* [Kibana/Discover: catchall logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=('columns':!('json.class','json.queue','json.job_status','json.scheduling_latency_s','json.duration_s'),'filters':!(('query':('match':('json.type':('query':'sidekiq','type':'phrase')))),('query':('match':('json.shard':('query':'catchall','type':'phrase'))))),'index':'AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l')&_g=(time:(from:now-1h,to:now)))
* [Kibana/Discover: catchall slow request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=('columns':!('json.class','json.queue','json.job_status','json.scheduling_latency_s','json.duration_s'),'filters':!(('query':('match':('json.type':('query':'sidekiq','type':'phrase')))),('query':('match':('json.shard':('query':'catchall','type':'phrase')))),('query':('range':('json.duration_s':('gte':300))))),'index':'AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l')&_g=(time:(from:now-1h,to:now)))
* [Kibana/Discover: catchall failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=('columns':!('json.class','json.queue','json.job_status','json.scheduling_latency_s','json.duration_s'),'filters':!(('query':('match':('json.type':('query':'sidekiq','type':'phrase')))),('query':('match':('json.shard':('query':'catchall','type':'phrase')))),('query':('match':('json.job_status':('query':'fail','type':'phrase'))))),'index':'AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l')&_g=(time:(from:now-1h,to:now)))

* [Kibana/Visualize: catchall failed request](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l&_a=('filters':!(('query':('match':('json.type':('query':'sidekiq','type':'phrase')))),('query':('match':('json.shard':('query':'catchall','type':'phrase')))),('query':('match':('json.job_status':('query':'fail','type':'phrase'))))),'vis':('aggs':!(('enabled':!t,'id':'1','params':(),'schema':'metric','type':'count'),('enabled':!t,'id':'2','params':('drop_partials':!t,'extended_bounds':(),'field':'json.time','interval':'auto','min_doc_count':1,'scaleMetricValues':!f,'timeRange':('from':'now-1h','to':'now'),'useNormalizedEsInterval':!t),'schema':'segment','type':'date_histogram'))))&_g=(time:(from:now-1h,to:now)))
* [Kibana/Visualize: catchall request latencies](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l&_a=('filters':!(('query':('match':('json.type':('query':'sidekiq','type':'phrase')))),('query':('match':('json.shard':('query':'catchall','type':'phrase'))))),'vis':('aggs':!(('enabled':!t,'id':'1','params':('field':'json.duration_s','percents':!(50,95,99)),'schema':'metric','type':'percentiles'),('enabled':!t,'id':'2','params':('drop_partials':!t,'extended_bounds':(),'field':'json.time','interval':'auto','min_doc_count':1,'scaleMetricValues':!f,'timeRange':('from':'now-1h','to':'now'),'useNormalizedEsInterval':!t),'schema':'segment','type':'date_histogram'))))&_g=(time:(from:now-1h,to:now)))

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Rails uses connection pools for its database connections. As each
node may have multiple connection pools, this is by node and by
database host.

If this resource is saturated, it may indicate that our connection
pools are not correctly sized, perhaps because an unexpected
application thread is using a database connection.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, instance, host, port) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(gitlab_database_connection_pool_busy{class="ActiveRecord::Base", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
        +
        avg_over_time(gitlab_database_connection_pool_dead{class="ActiveRecord::Base", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      /
      gitlab_database_connection_pool_size{class="ActiveRecord::Base", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: rails_db_connection_pool component saturation: Rails DB Connection Pool Utilization

This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq", component="shard_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Sidekiq worker utilization per shard.

This metric represents the percentage of available threads*workers that are actively processing jobs.

When this metric is saturated, new Sidekiq jobs will queue. Depending on whether or not the jobs are latency sensitive,
this could impact user experience.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        avg_over_time(sidekiq_running_jobs{shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|memory-bound", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        avg_over_time(sidekiq_concurrency{shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|memory-bound", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: sidekiq_shard_workers component saturation: Sidekiq Worker Utilization per shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Puma thread utilization per node.

Puma uses a fixed size thread pool to handle HTTP requests. This metric shows how many threads are busy handling requests. When this resource is saturated,
we will see puma queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Puma saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Puma saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (avg_over_time(puma_active_connections{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"}[1m]))
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (puma_max_threads{pid="puma_master", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sidekiq"})
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.description: The number of records waiting to be synced to Elasticsearch for Global Search. These are picked up in batches every minute. Lower is better but the batching every minute means it will not usually stay at 0. Steady growth over a sustained period of time indicates that ElasticIndexBulkCronWorker is not keeping up.
panels.title: Global search incremental indexing queue length

panels.description: The number of records waiting to be synced to Elasticsearch for Global Search during initial project backfill. These jobs are created when projects are imported or when Elasticsearch is enabled for a group in order to backfill all project data to the index. These are picked up in batches every minute. Lower is better but the batching every minute means it will not usually stay at 0. Sudden spikes are expected if a large group is enabled for Elasticsearch but sustained steady growth over a long period of time may indicate that ElasticIndexInitialBulkCronWorker is not keeping up.

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="sidekiq", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="sidekiq", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="sidekiq",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)
